currentFile.content:
# Changelog

All notable changes to The Story Test Framework will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).

## [Unreleased]

## [1.3.0] - 2025-10-16

### Added
- Acts 12-13 Integration
  - Act 12 (Act12MentalModelClaims.cs) - Validates claims have evidence
  - Act 13 (Act13NarrativeCoherence.cs) - Validates architecture coherence
  - Reporter (mental_model_reporter.py) - Dynamic analysis & reporting
- Configuration-Driven Validation
  - storytest-mental-model.json for project narrative definition
  - Supports: claimed capabilities, required artifacts, architectural rules, quality gates
- Multi-Output Reporting
  - JSON for automation
  - HTML for visualization
  - Exit codes for CI/CD flow control

## [1.2.1] - 2025-10-15

### Fixed
- CI/CD workflow Unity version mismatch (updated from 2022.3.17f1 to 6000.0.30f1 to match project version)
- False positive violation for `IEnumerator.Reset()` in compiler-generated iterator state machines
- Enhanced compiler-generated member detection in both C# and Python validators to skip explicit interface implementations in state machines
- Python validation script (`story_test.py`) now properly filters compiler-generated iterator/async state machine members

### Changed
- Improved release script to update all three version files atomically (Unity package.json, root package.json, pyproject.toml)

## [1.2.0] - 2025-10-14

### Added
- Unity-safe Python validator (`story_test_unity_safe.py`) for standalone validation
- Reality anchor system (`REALITY_CHECK.md`) for accurate project status tracking
- False positive filtering for compiler-generated artifacts (Roslyn, Unity lifecycle)
- Anti-false-celebration documentation practices for AI assistants

### Fixed
- Python validator Unity dependency crashes (`UnityEngine.CoreModule` loading failures)
- 30 false positives from enum interface methods and delegate artifacts
- Configuration path issues in `StoryTestSettings.json`
- Documentation drift (9 Acts vs actual 11 Acts)

### Improved
- CI/CD pipeline with Linux-first canonical builds
- Cross-platform Python validation without Unity installation requirements
- Assembly loading with graceful fallback for Unity-dependent assemblies

## [1.1.0] - 2025-10-07

### Added
- Complete GitHub Actions workflow with Linux canonical builds
- Unity Playmode test integration with sync-point performance testing
- Python CoreCLR runtime support for better cross-platform compatibility
- Automated assembly discovery and validation

### Fixed
- Platform identifier errors (Linux64 â†’ StandaloneLinux64)
- Action version deprecation warnings (migrated to @v4/@v5 tags)
- Unity assembly loading in standalone Python validator
- Linter configuration for GitHub Actions validation

### Changed
- Migrated from commit SHAs to major version tags for GitHub Actions
- Implemented cost-optimized CI/CD (Linux-first, manual Windows/macOS)
- Enhanced error handling for Unity dependency resolution

## [1.0.0] - 2025-09-30

### Added
- Initial release of Story Test Framework
- 11 validation Acts for IL bytecode analysis
- Unity Editor integration with menu system
- ProductionExcellenceStoryTest MonoBehaviour
- StoryIntegrityValidator with automatic rule discovery
- Python standalone validator with .NET reflection
- Comprehensive test suite with NUnit integration

### Features
- **Act 1**: Todo Comments (NotImplementedException detection)
- **Act 2**: Placeholder Implementations (minimal IL detection)
- **Act 3**: Incomplete Classes (abstract method implementation)
- **Act 4**: Unsealed Abstract Members (abstract method sealing)
- **Act 5**: Debug Only Implementations ([Obsolete] requirement)
- **Act 6**: Phantom Props (unused auto-properties)
- **Act 7**: Cold Methods (empty/minimal methods)
- **Act 8**: Hollow Enums (minimal enum values)
- **Act 9**: Premature Celebrations (complete but throwing)
- **Act 10**: Suspiciously Simple Methods (constant returns)
- **Act 11**: Dead Code (unused fields/properties/methods)

### Architecture
- Multi-assembly structure with clear separation of concerns
- Unity-agnostic core validation logic
- Conditional compilation for cross-platform compatibility
- StoryIgnoreAttribute for intentional exclusions
- Dynamic rule registration via reflection

## Development History Archive

### Phase 4: Production Readiness (2025-10)
- Focus on human handoff preparation
- Documentation consolidation and versioning
- Python validator production hardening
- False positive elimination

### Phase 3.5: Runtime Restoration (2025-09)
- Restored Unity runtime integration
- Fixed assembly loading issues
- Enhanced sync-point performance testing
- Improved error handling and reporting

### Phase 2.5: Workflow Fixes (2025-09)
- Resolved GitHub Actions platform issues
- Fixed Unity build configuration
- Optimized CI/CD performance
- Enhanced cross-platform compatibility

### Phase 2: Package Conversion (2025-08)
- Migrated to Unity Package format
- Implemented proper assembly structure
- Added comprehensive documentation
- Established CI/CD pipeline

### Phase 1: Foundation (2025-07)
- Initial framework development
- Core validation logic implementation
- Unity Editor integration
- Python validator creation

---

## Version Scheme

This project follows [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html):

- **MAJOR**: Breaking changes that require user intervention
- **MINOR**: New features, improvements, non-breaking changes
- **PATCH**: Bug fixes, documentation updates, performance improvements

### Release Cadence
- **Major releases**: Significant architectural changes or breaking API modifications
- **Minor releases**: New validation Acts, feature enhancements, platform support
- **Patch releases**: Bug fixes, false positive elimination, documentation updates

### Compatibility Guarantees
- **Backward compatibility**: Maintained within major versions
- **Forward compatibility**: Best effort, but not guaranteed
- **API stability**: Public interfaces stable within major versions
- **Configuration stability**: Settings format stable within major versions

content.text: Workflow partial failure - Run python -m twine check dist/* Checking dist/storytest-1.3.0-py3-none-any.whl: PASSED Checking dist/com.tinywalnutgames.storytest-1.1.0.tgz: ERROR    InvalidDistribution: Unknown distribution format:                                'com.tinywalnutgames.storytest-1.1.0.tgz'                               Error: Process completed with exit code 1.

The user is showing a workflow error where `twine check` is failing on a `.tgz` file with an unexpected format. The issue is:

1. The Python package built correctly: `storytest-1.3.0-py3-none-any.whl` âœ“
2. But there's also a `.tgz` file: `com.tinywalnutgames.storytest-1.1.0.tgz` âœ— (wrong version!)

There are TWO problems here:
1. The `.tgz` file has version 1.1.0 (wrong! should be 1.3.0)
2. The `.tgz` file shouldn't be in dist/ - it's not a valid Python distribution format that twine recognizes

The `.tgz` filename suggests it might be the Unity package being packaged incorrectly. The build script is probably archiving the Unity package files and putting them in dist/, which twine then tries to validate.

Let me check the build scripts to see what's creating this `.tgz` file.

The build_pypi.ps1 script just runs `python -m build` which should create the wheel and sdist (tar.gz). The problem is that there's a `.tgz` file with the wrong version number (1.1.0 instead of 1.3.0), and it has the Unity package name in it.

Let me check the workflow file to see what's creating this extra `.tgz` file.
Let me check the publish.yml workflow since that's likely where the twine check is failing.

The workflow is straightforward - it just runs `python -m build` and then checks the dist/* files. The problem is that something is creating a `.tgz` file with the Unity package name and the old version.

Let me check the pyproject.toml and setup.py to see if there's some custom build configuration creating extra artifacts.

The pyproject.toml is properly configured for version 1.3.0. The issue is that there's a stray `.tgz` file being created from somewhere - probably from an older build or it's being created by something else.

The error shows:
- `storytest-1.3.0-py3-none-any.whl` (correct, version 1.3.0)
- `com.tinywalnutgames.storytest-1.1.0.tgz` (wrong, version 1.1.0, and it's the Unity package name)

This `.tgz` file shouldn't exist. It looks like it might be:
1. Left over from a previous build
2. Or being created by a custom build step that's packaging the Unity files

Let me check if there's a MANIFEST.in or setup.cfg that might be including extra files, or if the release automation workflow is creating this.
Let me check the release-automation.yml workflow file.

The release-automation.yml doesn't seem to be creating that `.tgz` file. The issue is likely that:

1. The workflow runs `python -m build` which creates the standard Python distributions
2. Something is leaving a stray `.tgz` file from a previous build with the old version (1.1.0)

The `.tgz` file with name `com.tinywalnutgames.storytest-1.1.0.tgz` looks like it might be:
- A leftover from testing
- Or accidentally created by some other build system

The solution is simple: we need to make sure that only valid Python packages end up in dist/. We can either:
1. Skip the `.tgz` file in the twine check command
2. Delete the `.tgz` file before running twine check
3. Or find and remove the source of the `.tgz` file

Let me check what twine check actually does - it validates that the package is valid for PyPI. The `.tgz` with the name of a Unity package shouldn't be in the dist/ directory at all for a Python package build.

The fix is to filter twine check to only check `.whl` and `.tar.gz` files that match the Python package name. Let me modify the publish.yml to be more specific.
The issue is a stray `.tgz` file with the old version (1.1.0) and Unity package name. Let me fix the workflow to only validate Python distributions:

content.lineBasedDiff:
--- E:/Tiny_Walnut_Games/TheStoryTest/.github/workflows/publish.yml
+++ E:/Tiny_Walnut_Games/TheStoryTest/.github/workflows/publish.yml
@@ -32,7 +32,9 @@
       run: python -m build
 
     - name: Check package
-      run: python -m twine check dist/*
+      run: |
+        python -m twine check dist/storytest-*.whl dist/storytest-*.tar.gz 2>/dev/null || \
+        python -m twine check dist/storytest-*
 
     - name: Upload to TestPyPI
       if: github.event.inputs.test == 'true'

content.text:
Actually, that's not the best solution. Let me think about this more carefully. The real issue is that there's a `.tgz` file being created with the wrong name. 

A better approach would be to:
1. Clean up dist before building
2. Or list what's in dist first to see what's there
3. Or only upload the storytest packages

Actually, let me just use a more robust approach that explicitly finds only the storytest distributions:

content.lineBasedDiff:
--- E:/Tiny_Walnut_Games/TheStoryTest/.github/workflows/publish.yml
+++ E:/Tiny_Walnut_Games/TheStoryTest/.github/workflows/publish.yml
@@ -31,10 +31,11 @@
     - name: Build package
       run: python -m build
 
+    - name: List package contents
+      run: ls -la dist/
+
     - name: Check package
-      run: |
-        python -m twine check dist/storytest-*.whl dist/storytest-*.tar.gz 2>/dev/null || \
-        python -m twine check dist/storytest-*
+      run: python -m twine check dist/storytest-*
 
     - name: Upload to TestPyPI
       if: github.event.inputs.test == 'true'

content.text:
Actually, that won't work either because the twine command will still fail. Let me also fix the upload commands to match the same pattern. But first, I need to understand - the stray `.tgz` file shouldn't be created by `python -m build` at all. 

Let me check if there's something in the project that's creating it. But for now, the quickest fix is to exclude non-storytest files from both checking and uploading.

content.lineBasedDiff:
--- E:/Tiny_Walnut_Games/TheStoryTest/.github/workflows/publish.yml
+++ E:/Tiny_Walnut_Games/TheStoryTest/.github/workflows/publish.yml
@@ -42,11 +42,11 @@
       env:
         TWINE_USERNAME: __token__
         TWINE_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.TEST_PYPI_API_TOKEN }}
-      run: python -m twine upload --repository testpypi dist/*
+      run: python -m twine upload --repository testpypi dist/storytest-*
 
     - name: Upload to PyPI
       if: github.event.inputs.test != 'true'
       env:
         TWINE_USERNAME: __token__
         TWINE_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.PYPI_API_TOKEN }}
-      run: python -m twine upload dist/*
+      run: python -m twine upload dist/storytest-*

name: Publish to PyPI

on:
  release:
    types: [published]
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      test:
        description: 'Upload to TestPyPI instead of PyPI'
        required: false
        default: 'false'
        type: boolean

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4

    - name: Set up Python
      uses: actions/setup-python@v4
      with:
        python-version: '3.9'

    - name: Install dependencies
      run: |
        python -m pip install --upgrade pip
        python -m pip install build twine

    - name: Build package
      run: python -m build

    - name: List package contents
      run: ls -la dist/

    - name: Check package
      run: python -m twine check dist/storytest-*

    - name: Upload to TestPyPI
      if: github.event.inputs.test == 'true'
      env:
        TWINE_USERNAME: __token__
        TWINE_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.TEST_PYPI_API_TOKEN }}
      run: python -m twine upload --repository testpypi dist/storytest-*

    - name: Upload to PyPI
      if: github.event.inputs.test != 'true'
      env:
        TWINE_USERNAME: __token__
        TWINE_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.PYPI_API_TOKEN }}
      run: python -m twine upload dist/storytest-*

## Solution
Added to the `create-release` job:
```yaml
permissions:
  contents: write
```

This grants the workflow token the necessary permissions to:
- Create releases âœ“
- Write to repository contents âœ“
- Update tags âœ“

Now when the workflow runs, the `softprops/action-gh-release` action will have the correct permissions using your default `GITHUB_TOKEN`. Try the release again and it should work! ðŸš€

content.text: Now I need to create the merge-back-to-main.yml workflow that will automatically merge the release branch back to main and develop after a successful release.
Now create the merge-back workflow:

content.lineBasedDiff:
--- E:/Tiny_Walnut_Games/TheStoryTest/.github/workflows/merge-back-to-main.yml
+++ E:/Tiny_Walnut_Games/TheStoryTest/.github/workflows/merge-back-to-main.yml
@@ -0,0 +1,58 @@
+name: ðŸ”„ Merge Release Back to Main
+
+# After successful release, merges release branch back to main and develop
+# Maintains branch consistency and prevents drift
+
+on:
+  workflow_dispatch:
+
+permissions:
+  contents: write
+  pull-requests: write
+
+jobs:
+  merge-back:
+    name: ðŸ”„ Merge release â†’ main â†’ develop
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+
+    steps:
+      - name: ðŸ“¥ Checkout repository
+        uses: actions/checkout@v4
+        with:
+          fetch-depth: 0
+
+      - name: ðŸ”§ Configure Git
+        run: |
+          git config --global user.name "Story Test Bot"
+          git config --global user.email "bot@tinywalnutgames.com"
+
+      - name: ðŸ“ Get current version
+        id: version
+        run: |
+          VERSION=$(jq -r '.version' Packages/com.tinywalnutgames.storytest/package.json)
+          echo "version=$VERSION" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
+          echo "ðŸ“Œ Current version: $VERSION"
+
+      - name: ðŸ”€ Merge release â†’ main
+        run: |
+          git fetch origin
+          git checkout main
+          git merge origin/release --no-ff -m "ðŸ”€ Merge release v${{ steps.version.outputs.version }} to main"
+          git push origin main
+          echo "âœ… Successfully merged release to main"
+
+      - name: ðŸ”€ Merge main â†’ develop
+        run: |
+          git fetch origin
+          git checkout develop
+          git merge origin/main --no-ff -m "ðŸ”€ Merge main back to develop after release v${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}"
+          git push origin develop
+          echo "âœ… Successfully merged main to develop"
+
+      - name: ðŸ“¢ Notify
+        run: |
+          echo "âœ… Release v${{ steps.version.outputs.version }} propagated to all branches"
+          echo "ðŸ“Š Branch Status:"
+          echo "  - main: Updated with release"
+          echo "  - develop: Updated with latest from main"
+          echo "  - release: Ready for next release cycle"

--- E:/Tiny_Walnut_Games/TheStoryTest/.github/BRANCH_PROTECTION_GUIDE.md
+++ E:/Tiny_Walnut_Games/TheStoryTest/.github/BRANCH_PROTECTION_GUIDE.md
@@ -0,0 +1,203 @@
+# ðŸ” Branch Protection Configuration Guide
+
+This document outlines the branch protection rules for the three-branch release strategy:
+- **`develop`** (moderate protection) - where features are developed
+- **`release`** (light protection) - where releases are prepared and published
+- **`main`** (strict protection) - production releases only
+
+## Three-Branch Strategy Overview
+
+```
+develop (feature branches merge here)
+   â†“
+develop â†’ release (when ready to release)
+   â†“
+release (tag version, publish to PyPI, tests run)
+   â†“
+release â†’ main (merge back after successful release)
+   â†“
+main (production - always stable)
+   â†“
+main â†’ develop (merge back to keep in sync)
+```
+
+**As a solo developer**, you can push directly to `develop` and `release` branches, but the workflows ensure quality and consistency.
+
+---
+
+## âš™ï¸ Configuration Steps
+
+### 1. **`main` Branch (Strict Protection)**
+
+Navigate to: **Settings â†’ Branches â†’ Add rule**
+
+#### Rule Name Pattern
+- `main`
+
+#### Protection Settings
+
+**âœ… Require a pull request before merging**
+- Require approvals: **0** (you're solo, but workflow checks must pass)
+- Dismiss stale pull request approvals when new commits are pushed: *Checked*
+- Require review from code owners: *Unchecked*
+
+**âœ… Require status checks to pass before merging**
+- Status checks that must pass:
+  - `Quick Static Analysis` (from story-test.yml)
+  - `Full Validation` (from story-test.yml)
+  - (Any other critical checks)
+
+**âœ… Require branches to be up to date before merging**
+- *Checked*
+
+**âœ… Require deployments to succeed before merging**
+- *(Optional)* Can include PyPI deployment check
+
+**âœ… Include administrators in restrictions**
+- *Checked* (enforces rules even for you)
+
+**âŒ Do NOT check**
+- Restrict who can push to matching branches (you need to push to this branch after release)
+
+---
+
+### 2. **`release` Branch (Light Protection)**
+
+Navigate to: **Settings â†’ Branches â†’ Add rule**
+
+#### Rule Name Pattern
+- `release`
+
+#### Protection Settings
+
+**âœ… Require a pull request before merging**
+- Require approvals: **0**
+- Dismiss stale pull request approvals when new commits are pushed: *Checked*
+
+**âœ… Require status checks to pass before merging**
+- Status checks that must pass:
+  - `Quick Static Analysis` (from story-test.yml)
+
+**âŒ Do NOT require**
+- Require branches to be up to date
+- Require deployments to succeed
+- Restrict administrators
+
+**ðŸ’¡ Why lighter?** Because:
+- Release branch is for finalizing releases only
+- You'll push version bumps and tags directly here
+- You want minimal friction for the release process
+
+---
+
+### 3. **`develop` Branch (Moderate Protection)**
+
+Navigate to: **Settings â†’ Branches â†’ Add rule**
+
+#### Rule Name Pattern
+- `develop`
+
+#### Protection Settings
+
+**âœ… Require a pull request before merging**
+- Require approvals: **0** (you're solo)
+- Dismiss stale pull request approvals when new commits are pushed: *Checked*
+
+**âœ… Require status checks to pass before merging**
+- Status checks that must pass:
+  - `Quick Static Analysis`
+  - `Full Validation` (optional - for stricter control)
+
+**âœ… Require branches to be up to date before merging**
+- *Checked* (prevents accidental merge conflicts)
+
+**âŒ Do NOT restrict**
+- Administrator push restrictions (you'll need to push version bumps)
+
+**ðŸ’¡ Why moderate?** Because:
+- This is where features are developed
+- You want fast feedback but consistency
+- Version bumps are pushed here too
+
+---
+
+## ðŸ“‹ Quick Reference Table
+
+| Setting | `main` | `release` | `develop` |
+|---------|--------|-----------|-----------|
+| **Require PR** | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… |
+| **Approvals needed** | 0 | 0 | 0 |
+| **Status checks** | âœ… (All) | âœ… (Quick) | âœ… (Moderate) |
+| **Up-to-date required** | âœ… | âŒ | âœ… |
+| **Admin restrictions** | âœ… | âŒ | âŒ |
+| **Direct push allowed** | âŒ | âœ… | âœ… |
+
+---
+
+## ðŸš€ Typical Release Workflow
+
+```bash
+# 1. Work on features in develop
+git checkout develop
+git pull origin develop
+# ... make changes ...
+git push origin develop
+
+# 2. When ready for release, switch to release branch
+git checkout release
+git pull origin release
+
+# 3. Merge develop into release
+git merge develop
+
+# 4. Run release script (bumps version in all files)
+./scripts/release.ps1 bump minor
+git push origin release --tags
+
+# 5. Automation takes over:
+#    - release-automation.yml validates and publishes to PyPI
+#    - merge-back-to-main.yml merges back: release â†’ main â†’ develop
+#    - All branches stay in sync!
+
+# 6. Confirm the merge back completed
+git fetch origin
+git checkout main
+git pull origin main
+git checkout develop
+git pull origin develop
+```
+
+---
+
+## ðŸ”§ Customization Notes
+
+### If you want stricter `develop` protection:
+Add `Full Validation` to the status checks for longer but more thorough checks before merge.
+
+### If you want to prevent direct pushes:
+Enable "Restrict who can push to matching branches" on `main` (but keep disabled on `release` and `develop` for solo work).
+
+### For organization secrets:
+The workflows already use `${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}` which has proper permissions. No need for custom secrets for releases.
+
+---
+
+## âš¡ Troubleshooting
+
+### "Resource not accessible by integration" error on release?
+- âœ… Already fixed! We added `permissions: { contents: write }` to the release workflow
+
+### Merge conflicts when merging back?
+- This is rare. If it happens: manually resolve in the merge-back workflow or trigger a fresh sync
+
+### Want to skip a branch protection check temporarily?
+- You can't (by design!), but you can create a new branch, merge to it, then merge to main
+- Or: temporarily disable the rule, do the action, then re-enable
+
+---
+
+## ðŸ“š Related Documentation
+
+- [Release Process](../docs/RELEASE_PROCESS.md)
+- [CI/CD Configuration](../docs/ci-cd.md)
+- [GitHub Workflows](./README.md)

content.lineBasedDiff:
--- E:/Tiny_Walnut_Games/TheStoryTest/.github/THREE_BRANCH_WORKFLOW.md
+++ E:/Tiny_Walnut_Games/TheStoryTest/.github/THREE_BRANCH_WORKFLOW.md
@@ -0,0 +1,229 @@
+# ðŸŒ³ Three-Branch Workflow Guide
+
+Quick reference for your daily development and release workflow.
+
+## ðŸ“ Branch Purposes
+
+| Branch | Purpose | Protection | Direct Push? |
+|--------|---------|-----------|--------------|
+| `develop` | Feature development | Moderate | âœ… Yes |
+| `release` | Release preparation | Light | âœ… Yes |
+| `main` | Production releases | Strict | âŒ Via PR only |
+
+---
+
+## ðŸ’» Daily Development
+
+### Starting feature work
+```bash
+git checkout develop
+git pull origin develop
+# ... make changes ...
+git commit -am "Add awesome feature"
+git push origin develop
+```
+
+### Version bump (before release)
+```bash
+git checkout develop
+./scripts/release.ps1 bump minor  # or bump major/patch
+git push origin develop
+# Workflows run automatically to validate
+```
+
+---
+
+## ðŸš€ Release Process
+
+### Step 1: Prepare Release Branch
+```bash
+git checkout release
+git pull origin release
+git merge develop              # or rebase if you prefer
+git push origin release
+```
+
+### Step 2: Tag and Release
+```bash
+# Option A: Use release script (recommended)
+./scripts/release.ps1 bump minor
+git push origin release --tags
+
+# Option B: Manual tag
+git tag v1.3.0
+git push origin release --tags
+```
+
+### Step 3: Automation âœ¨
+1. **`release-automation.yml` runs:**
+   - âœ… Validates code quality
+   - âœ… Publishes to PyPI
+   - âœ… Creates GitHub release with notes
+   - âœ… Triggers merge-back workflow
+
+2. **`merge-back-to-main.yml` runs:**
+   - âœ… Merges `release` â†’ `main`
+   - âœ… Merges `main` â†’ `develop`
+   - âœ… All branches stay in sync!
+
+### Step 4: Verify
+```bash
+git fetch origin
+git log --oneline origin/main -5
+git log --oneline origin/develop -5
+# Should see your release merge
+```
+
+---
+
+## ðŸš¨ Common Scenarios
+
+### "I made a mistake in develop, can I fix it?"
+**Yes!** Commit fixes directly to develop:
+```bash
+git checkout develop
+git commit -am "Fix: typo in validation logic"
+git push origin develop
+```
+
+### "I want to release from develop immediately"
+**That's fine!** Skip release branch temporarily:
+```bash
+# Faster release (only do for hotfixes)
+git checkout develop
+./scripts/release.ps1 bump patch
+git push origin develop --tags
+# Automation takes over
+```
+
+### "I need to revert a release"
+```bash
+# On release branch, revert the tag
+git checkout release
+git tag -d v1.3.0
+git push origin :v1.3.0  # Delete from remote
+# Then fix the issue and re-release with same/new version
+```
+
+### "Status checks are failing on main"
+The merge-back workflow will wait. Don't manually merge! Instead:
+```bash
+git checkout develop
+# Fix the issue
+git push origin develop
+# Retry the merge-back workflow from GitHub Actions
+```
+
+---
+
+## ðŸ”„ Branch Sync Strategy
+
+All workflows automatically keep branches in sync:
+
+```
+develop (your features)
+   â†“ (merge when ready)
+release (prepare for release)
+   â†“ (tag and push)
+PUBLISH TO PYPI âœ¨
+   â†“ (auto-merge-back)
+main (production snapshot)
+   â†“ (auto-merge)
+develop (back in sync!)
+```
+
+**Result:** You only need to manage `develop`. Everything else syncs automatically.
+
+---
+
+## ðŸ“Š Branch Status Check
+
+```bash
+# Quick status of all three branches
+git fetch origin
+echo "=== DEVELOP ==="
+git log --oneline origin/develop -3
+echo ""
+echo "=== RELEASE ==="
+git log --oneline origin/release -3
+echo ""
+echo "=== MAIN ==="
+git log --oneline origin/main -3
+```
+
+---
+
+## âš¡ Pro Tips
+
+### Tip 1: Automatic Branch Protection
+All branches have status checks. If tests fail on develop, don't worryâ€”just fix and push again:
+```bash
+git checkout develop
+# Fix the issue
+git push origin develop
+# Workflows re-run automatically
+```
+
+### Tip 2: Release Branch is Your Staging
+Use the `release` branch like a staging environment:
+```bash
+git checkout release
+git merge develop
+git push origin release
+# Push to release first to let workflows validate
+# If tests pass, then tag and publish
+git tag v1.3.0
+git push origin release --tags
+```
+
+### Tip 3: Hotfixes
+For urgent hotfixes:
+```bash
+git checkout release
+git pull origin release
+# Fix the bug
+git commit -am "Hotfix: critical bug"
+git tag v1.2.2
+git push origin release --tags
+```
+
+### Tip 4: Keep Develop Fresh
+Before starting new work:
+```bash
+git checkout develop
+git fetch origin
+git reset --hard origin/develop
+# Now you're in sync with the merged releases
+```
+
+---
+
+## ðŸŽ¯ The Big Picture
+
+You only need to think about **two branches**:
+
+1. **`develop`** - where you work
+2. **`release`** - where you publish from
+
+Everything else (`main`, branches syncing, PyPI publishing) is **automated**. âœ¨
+
+```
+Your workflow:
+1. Code in develop (push anytime)
+2. When ready to release:
+   - Merge develop to release
+   - Push tags to release
+   - Go have coffee â˜•
+3. Automation handles:
+   - Validation âœ“
+   - PyPI publishing âœ“
+   - Main branch update âœ“
+   - Develop syncing âœ“
+4. You're done! ðŸŽ‰
+```
+
+---
+
+## ðŸ“š See Also
+- [Branch Protection Configuration](./BRANCH_PROTECTION_GUIDE.md)
+- [Release Process Documentation](../docs/RELEASE_PROCESS.md)

content.text: Great! All changes are committed and pushed. Now let me provide a summary of what I've set up.

Perfect! âœ… **Three-branch release strategy is now set up!** Here's what I created:

## ðŸ“¦ What Changed

### 1. **Updated Workflows** (automatically sync branches)
- âœ… `release-automation.yml` - Now triggers on `release` branch + tags, includes permission fix
- âœ… `merge-back-to-main.yml` - Auto-merges: release â†’ main â†’ develop after successful publish
- âœ… `story-test.yml` - Now validates `release` branch too

### 2. **Documentation Created**
- ðŸ“„ **`BRANCH_PROTECTION_GUIDE.md`** - Complete setup instructions for GitHub branch protection rules
- ðŸ“„ **`THREE_BRANCH_WORKFLOW.md`** - Your daily workflow guide (quick reference)

---

## ðŸš€ Your New Workflow

**You only manage 2 branches:**

```
develop â† your features (unlimited pushes)
  â†“
release â† when ready to release (tag & push)
  â†“
AUTOMATION âœ¨ handles:
  âœ… Validates code
  âœ… Publishes to PyPI  
  âœ… Creates GitHub release
  âœ… Merges back: release â†’ main â†’ develop
  â†“
main â† production (protected, no rule friction)
```

---

## âš™ï¸ Next Steps (Setup in GitHub)

Go to **Settings â†’ Branches** and add these rules:

### **`main` branch** - Strict
- âœ… Require PR (0 approvals)
- âœ… Require status checks to pass
- âœ… Require up-to-date before merge
- âœ… Include admins in restrictions

### **`release` branch** - Light  
- âœ… Require PR (0 approvals)
- âœ… Require quick status checks only
- âŒ NO up-to-date required (faster releases)
- âŒ NO admin restrictions (you can push directly)

### **`develop` branch** - Moderate
- âœ… Require PR (0 approvals)
- âœ… Require status checks
- âœ… Require up-to-date before merge

**See `BRANCH_PROTECTION_GUIDE.md` for exact settings with explanations.**

---

## ðŸ’¡ Key Benefits

âœ… **`main` stays protected** - Only merges from release workflow  
âœ… **`release` is light** - No friction for releasing  
âœ… **`develop` is working** - Where you code freely  
âœ… **Auto-merge-back** - Branches always stay in sync  
âœ… **No review bottleneck** - Status checks work automatically for you

@@ -0,0 +1,1913 @@
+name: %F0%9F%94%84 Merge Release Back to Main%0D%0A%0D%0A# After successful release, merges release branch back to main and develop%0D%0A# Maintains branch consistency and prevents drift%0D%0A%0D%0Aon:%0D%0A  workflow_dispatch:%0D%0A%0D%0Apermissions:%0D%0A  contents: write%0D%0A  pull-requests: write%0D%0A%0D%0Ajobs:%0D%0A  merge-back:%0D%0A    name: %F0%9F%94%84 Merge release %E2%86%92 main %E2%86%92 develop%0D%0A    runs-on: ubuntu-latest%0D%0A%0D%0A    steps:%0D%0A      - name: %F0%9F%93%A5 Checkout repository%0D%0A        uses: actions/checkout@v4%0D%0A        with:%0D%0A          fetch-depth: 0%0D%0A%0D%0A      - name: %F0%9F%94%A7 Configure Git%0D%0A        run: %7C%0D%0A          git config --global user.name %22Story Test Bot%22%0D%0A          git config --global user.email %22bot@tinywalnutgames.com%22%0D%0A%0D%0A      - name: %F0%9F%93%8D Get current version%0D%0A        id: version%0D%0A        run: %7C%0D%0A          VERSION=$(jq -r '.version' Packages/com.tinywalnutgames.storytest/package.json)%0D%0A          echo %22version=$VERSION%22 %3E%3E $GITHUB_OUTPUT%0D%0A          echo %22%F0%9F%93%8C Current version: $VERSION%22%0D%0A%0D%0A      - name: %F0%9F%94%80 Merge release %E2%86%92 main%0D%0A        run: %7C%0D%0A          git fetch origin%0D%0A          git checkout main%0D%0A          git merge origin/release --no-ff -m %22%F0%9F%94%80 Merge release v$%7B%7B steps.version.outputs.version %7D%7D to main%22%0D%0A          git push origin main%0D%0A          echo %22%E2%9C%85 Successfully merged release to main%22%0D%0A%0D%0A      - name: %F0%9F%94%80 Merge main %E2%86%92 develop%0D%0A        run: %7C%0D%0A          git fetch origin%0D%0A          git checkout develop%0D%0A          git merge origin/main --no-ff -m %22%F0%9F%94%80 Merge main back to develop after release v$%7B%7B steps.version.outputs.version %7D%7D%22%0D%0A          git push origin develop%0D%0A          echo %22%E2%9C%85 Successfully merged main to develop%22%0D%0A%0D%0A      - name: %F0%9F%93%A2 Notify%0D%0A        run: %7C%0D%0A          echo %22%E2%9C%85 Release v$%7B%7B steps.version.outputs.version %7D%7D propagated to all branches%22%0D%0A          echo %22%F0%9F%93%8A Branch Status:%22%0D%0A          echo %22  - main: Updated with release%22%0D%0A          echo %22  - develop: Updated with latest from main%22%0D%0A          echo %22  - release: Ready for next release cycle%22

@@ -0,0 +1,5945 @@
+# %F0%9F%94%90 Branch Protection Configuration Guide%0D%0A%0D%0AThis document outlines the branch protection rules for the three-branch release strategy:%0D%0A- **%60develop%60** (moderate protection) - where features are developed%0D%0A- **%60release%60** (light protection) - where releases are prepared and published%0D%0A- **%60main%60** (strict protection) - production releases only%0D%0A%0D%0A## Three-Branch Strategy Overview%0D%0A%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0Adevelop (feature branches merge here)%0D%0A   %E2%86%93%0D%0Adevelop %E2%86%92 release (when ready to release)%0D%0A   %E2%86%93%0D%0Arelease (tag version, publish to PyPI, tests run)%0D%0A   %E2%86%93%0D%0Arelease %E2%86%92 main (merge back after successful release)%0D%0A   %E2%86%93%0D%0Amain (production - always stable)%0D%0A   %E2%86%93%0D%0Amain %E2%86%92 develop (merge back to keep in sync)%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A**As a solo developer**, you can push directly to %60develop%60 and %60release%60 branches, but the workflows ensure quality and consistency.%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %E2%9A%99%EF%B8%8F Configuration Steps%0D%0A%0D%0A### 1. **%60main%60 Branch (Strict Protection)**%0D%0A%0D%0ANavigate to: **Settings %E2%86%92 Branches %E2%86%92 Add rule**%0D%0A%0D%0A#### Rule Name Pattern%0D%0A- %60main%60%0D%0A%0D%0A#### Protection Settings%0D%0A%0D%0A**%E2%9C%85 Require a pull request before merging**%0D%0A- Require approvals: **0** (you're solo, but workflow checks must pass)%0D%0A- Dismiss stale pull request approvals when new commits are pushed: *Checked*%0D%0A- Require review from code owners: *Unchecked*%0D%0A%0D%0A**%E2%9C%85 Require status checks to pass before merging**%0D%0A- Status checks that must pass:%0D%0A  - %60Quick Static Analysis%60 (from story-test.yml)%0D%0A  - %60Full Validation%60 (from story-test.yml)%0D%0A  - (Any other critical checks)%0D%0A%0D%0A**%E2%9C%85 Require branches to be up to date before merging**%0D%0A- *Checked*%0D%0A%0D%0A**%E2%9C%85 Require deployments to succeed before merging**%0D%0A- *(Optional)* Can include PyPI deployment check%0D%0A%0D%0A**%E2%9C%85 Include administrators in restrictions**%0D%0A- *Checked* (enforces rules even for you)%0D%0A%0D%0A**%E2%9D%8C Do NOT check**%0D%0A- Restrict who can push to matching branches (you need to push to this branch after release)%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A### 2. **%60release%60 Branch (Light Protection)**%0D%0A%0D%0ANavigate to: **Settings %E2%86%92 Branches %E2%86%92 Add rule**%0D%0A%0D%0A#### Rule Name Pattern%0D%0A- %60release%60%0D%0A%0D%0A#### Protection Settings%0D%0A%0D%0A**%E2%9C%85 Require a pull request before merging**%0D%0A- Require approvals: **0**%0D%0A- Dismiss stale pull request approvals when new commits are pushed: *Checked*%0D%0A%0D%0A**%E2%9C%85 Require status checks to pass before merging**%0D%0A- Status checks that must pass:%0D%0A  - %60Quick Static Analysis%60 (from story-test.yml)%0D%0A%0D%0A**%E2%9D%8C Do NOT require**%0D%0A- Require branches to be up to date%0D%0A- Require deployments to succeed%0D%0A- Restrict administrators%0D%0A%0D%0A**%F0%9F%92%A1 Why lighter?** Because:%0D%0A- Release branch is for finalizing releases only%0D%0A- You'll push version bumps and tags directly here%0D%0A- You want minimal friction for the release process%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A### 3. **%60develop%60 Branch (Moderate Protection)**%0D%0A%0D%0ANavigate to: **Settings %E2%86%92 Branches %E2%86%92 Add rule**%0D%0A%0D%0A#### Rule Name Pattern%0D%0A- %60develop%60%0D%0A%0D%0A#### Protection Settings%0D%0A%0D%0A**%E2%9C%85 Require a pull request before merging**%0D%0A- Require approvals: **0** (you're solo)%0D%0A- Dismiss stale pull request approvals when new commits are pushed: *Checked*%0D%0A%0D%0A**%E2%9C%85 Require status checks to pass before merging**%0D%0A- Status checks that must pass:%0D%0A  - %60Quick Static Analysis%60%0D%0A  - %60Full Validation%60 (optional - for stricter control)%0D%0A%0D%0A**%E2%9C%85 Require branches to be up to date before merging**%0D%0A- *Checked* (prevents accidental merge conflicts)%0D%0A%0D%0A**%E2%9D%8C Do NOT restrict**%0D%0A- Administrator push restrictions (you'll need to push version bumps)%0D%0A%0D%0A**%F0%9F%92%A1 Why moderate?** Because:%0D%0A- This is where features are developed%0D%0A- You want fast feedback but consistency%0D%0A- Version bumps are pushed here too%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %F0%9F%93%8B Quick Reference Table%0D%0A%0D%0A%7C Setting %7C %60main%60 %7C %60release%60 %7C %60develop%60 %7C%0D%0A%7C---------%7C--------%7C-----------%7C-----------%7C%0D%0A%7C **Require PR** %7C %E2%9C%85 %7C %E2%9C%85 %7C %E2%9C%85 %7C%0D%0A%7C **Approvals needed** %7C 0 %7C 0 %7C 0 %7C%0D%0A%7C **Status checks** %7C %E2%9C%85 (All) %7C %E2%9C%85 (Quick) %7C %E2%9C%85 (Moderate) %7C%0D%0A%7C **Up-to-date required** %7C %E2%9C%85 %7C %E2%9D%8C %7C %E2%9C%85 %7C%0D%0A%7C **Admin restrictions** %7C %E2%9C%85 %7C %E2%9D%8C %7C %E2%9D%8C %7C%0D%0A%7C **Direct push allowed** %7C %E2%9D%8C %7C %E2%9C%85 %7C %E2%9C%85 %7C%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %F0%9F%9A%80 Typical Release Workflow%0D%0A%0D%0A%60%60%60bash%0D%0A# 1. Work on features in develop%0D%0Agit checkout develop%0D%0Agit pull origin develop%0D%0A# ... make changes ...%0D%0Agit push origin develop%0D%0A%0D%0A# 2. When ready for release, switch to release branch%0D%0Agit checkout release%0D%0Agit pull origin release%0D%0A%0D%0A# 3. Merge develop into release%0D%0Agit merge develop%0D%0A%0D%0A# 4. Run release script (bumps version in all files)%0D%0A./scripts/release.ps1 bump minor%0D%0Agit push origin release --tags%0D%0A%0D%0A# 5. Automation takes over:%0D%0A#    - release-automation.yml validates and publishes to PyPI%0D%0A#    - merge-back-to-main.yml merges back: release %E2%86%92 main %E2%86%92 develop%0D%0A#    - All branches stay in sync!%0D%0A%0D%0A# 6. Confirm the merge back completed%0D%0Agit fetch origin%0D%0Agit checkout main%0D%0Agit pull origin main%0D%0Agit checkout develop%0D%0Agit pull origin develop%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %F0%9F%94%A7 Customization Notes%0D%0A%0D%0A### If you want stricter %60develop%60 protection:%0D%0AAdd %60Full Validation%60 to the status checks for longer but more thorough checks before merge.%0D%0A%0D%0A### If you want to prevent direct pushes:%0D%0AEnable %22Restrict who can push to matching branches%22 on %60main%60 (but keep disabled on %60release%60 and %60develop%60 for solo work).%0D%0A%0D%0A### For organization secrets:%0D%0AThe workflows already use %60$%7B%7B secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN %7D%7D%60 which has proper permissions. No need for custom secrets for releases.%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %E2%9A%A1 Troubleshooting%0D%0A%0D%0A### %22Resource not accessible by integration%22 error on release?%0D%0A- %E2%9C%85 Already fixed! We added %60permissions: %7B contents: write %7D%60 to the release workflow%0D%0A%0D%0A### Merge conflicts when merging back?%0D%0A- This is rare. If it happens: manually resolve in the merge-back workflow or trigger a fresh sync%0D%0A%0D%0A### Want to skip a branch protection check temporarily?%0D%0A- You can't (by design!), but you can create a new branch, merge to it, then merge to main%0D%0A- Or: temporarily disable the rule, do the action, then re-enable%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %F0%9F%93%9A Related Documentation%0D%0A%0D%0A- %5BRelease Process%5D(../docs/RELEASE_PROCESS.md)%0D%0A- %5BCI/CD Configuration%5D(../docs/ci-cd.md)%0D%0A- %5BGitHub Workflows%5D(./README.md)

@@ -0,0 +1,5150 @@
+# %F0%9F%8C%B3 Three-Branch Workflow Guide%0D%0A%0D%0AQuick reference for your daily development and release workflow.%0D%0A%0D%0A## %F0%9F%93%8D Branch Purposes%0D%0A%0D%0A%7C Branch %7C Purpose %7C Protection %7C Direct Push? %7C%0D%0A%7C--------%7C---------%7C-----------%7C--------------%7C%0D%0A%7C %60develop%60 %7C Feature development %7C Moderate %7C %E2%9C%85 Yes %7C%0D%0A%7C %60release%60 %7C Release preparation %7C Light %7C %E2%9C%85 Yes %7C%0D%0A%7C %60main%60 %7C Production releases %7C Strict %7C %E2%9D%8C Via PR only %7C%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %F0%9F%92%BB Daily Development%0D%0A%0D%0A### Starting feature work%0D%0A%60%60%60bash%0D%0Agit checkout develop%0D%0Agit pull origin develop%0D%0A# ... make changes ...%0D%0Agit commit -am %22Add awesome feature%22%0D%0Agit push origin develop%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A### Version bump (before release)%0D%0A%60%60%60bash%0D%0Agit checkout develop%0D%0A./scripts/release.ps1 bump minor  # or bump major/patch%0D%0Agit push origin develop%0D%0A# Workflows run automatically to validate%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %F0%9F%9A%80 Release Process%0D%0A%0D%0A### Step 1: Prepare Release Branch%0D%0A%60%60%60bash%0D%0Agit checkout release%0D%0Agit pull origin release%0D%0Agit merge develop              # or rebase if you prefer%0D%0Agit push origin release%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A### Step 2: Tag and Release%0D%0A%60%60%60bash%0D%0A# Option A: Use release script (recommended)%0D%0A./scripts/release.ps1 bump minor%0D%0Agit push origin release --tags%0D%0A%0D%0A# Option B: Manual tag%0D%0Agit tag v1.3.0%0D%0Agit push origin release --tags%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A### Step 3: Automation %E2%9C%A8%0D%0A1. **%60release-automation.yml%60 runs:**%0D%0A   - %E2%9C%85 Validates code quality%0D%0A   - %E2%9C%85 Publishes to PyPI%0D%0A   - %E2%9C%85 Creates GitHub release with notes%0D%0A   - %E2%9C%85 Triggers merge-back workflow%0D%0A%0D%0A2. **%60merge-back-to-main.yml%60 runs:**%0D%0A   - %E2%9C%85 Merges %60release%60 %E2%86%92 %60main%60%0D%0A   - %E2%9C%85 Merges %60main%60 %E2%86%92 %60develop%60%0D%0A   - %E2%9C%85 All branches stay in sync!%0D%0A%0D%0A### Step 4: Verify%0D%0A%60%60%60bash%0D%0Agit fetch origin%0D%0Agit log --oneline origin/main -5%0D%0Agit log --oneline origin/develop -5%0D%0A# Should see your release merge%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %F0%9F%9A%A8 Common Scenarios%0D%0A%0D%0A### %22I made a mistake in develop, can I fix it?%22%0D%0A**Yes!** Commit fixes directly to develop:%0D%0A%60%60%60bash%0D%0Agit checkout develop%0D%0Agit commit -am %22Fix: typo in validation logic%22%0D%0Agit push origin develop%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A### %22I want to release from develop immediately%22%0D%0A**That's fine!** Skip release branch temporarily:%0D%0A%60%60%60bash%0D%0A# Faster release (only do for hotfixes)%0D%0Agit checkout develop%0D%0A./scripts/release.ps1 bump patch%0D%0Agit push origin develop --tags%0D%0A# Automation takes over%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A### %22I need to revert a release%22%0D%0A%60%60%60bash%0D%0A# On release branch, revert the tag%0D%0Agit checkout release%0D%0Agit tag -d v1.3.0%0D%0Agit push origin :v1.3.0  # Delete from remote%0D%0A# Then fix the issue and re-release with same/new version%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A### %22Status checks are failing on main%22%0D%0AThe merge-back workflow will wait. Don't manually merge! Instead:%0D%0A%60%60%60bash%0D%0Agit checkout develop%0D%0A# Fix the issue%0D%0Agit push origin develop%0D%0A# Retry the merge-back workflow from GitHub Actions%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %F0%9F%94%84 Branch Sync Strategy%0D%0A%0D%0AAll workflows automatically keep branches in sync:%0D%0A%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0Adevelop (your features)%0D%0A   %E2%86%93 (merge when ready)%0D%0Arelease (prepare for release)%0D%0A   %E2%86%93 (tag and push)%0D%0APUBLISH TO PYPI %E2%9C%A8%0D%0A   %E2%86%93 (auto-merge-back)%0D%0Amain (production snapshot)%0D%0A   %E2%86%93 (auto-merge)%0D%0Adevelop (back in sync!)%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A**Result:** You only need to manage %60develop%60. Everything else syncs automatically.%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %F0%9F%93%8A Branch Status Check%0D%0A%0D%0A%60%60%60bash%0D%0A# Quick status of all three branches%0D%0Agit fetch origin%0D%0Aecho %22=== DEVELOP ===%22%0D%0Agit log --oneline origin/develop -3%0D%0Aecho %22%22%0D%0Aecho %22=== RELEASE ===%22%0D%0Agit log --oneline origin/release -3%0D%0Aecho %22%22%0D%0Aecho %22=== MAIN ===%22%0D%0Agit log --oneline origin/main -3%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %E2%9A%A1 Pro Tips%0D%0A%0D%0A### Tip 1: Automatic Branch Protection%0D%0AAll branches have status checks. If tests fail on develop, don't worry%E2%80%94just fix and push again:%0D%0A%60%60%60bash%0D%0Agit checkout develop%0D%0A# Fix the issue%0D%0Agit push origin develop%0D%0A# Workflows re-run automatically%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A### Tip 2: Release Branch is Your Staging%0D%0AUse the %60release%60 branch like a staging environment:%0D%0A%60%60%60bash%0D%0Agit checkout release%0D%0Agit merge develop%0D%0Agit push origin release%0D%0A# Push to release first to let workflows validate%0D%0A# If tests pass, then tag and publish%0D%0Agit tag v1.3.0%0D%0Agit push origin release --tags%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A### Tip 3: Hotfixes%0D%0AFor urgent hotfixes:%0D%0A%60%60%60bash%0D%0Agit checkout release%0D%0Agit pull origin release%0D%0A# Fix the bug%0D%0Agit commit -am %22Hotfix: critical bug%22%0D%0Agit tag v1.2.2%0D%0Agit push origin release --tags%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A### Tip 4: Keep Develop Fresh%0D%0ABefore starting new work:%0D%0A%60%60%60bash%0D%0Agit checkout develop%0D%0Agit fetch origin%0D%0Agit reset --hard origin/develop%0D%0A# Now you're in sync with the merged releases%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %F0%9F%8E%AF The Big Picture%0D%0A%0D%0AYou only need to think about **two branches**:%0D%0A%0D%0A1. **%60develop%60** - where you work%0D%0A2. **%60release%60** - where you publish from%0D%0A%0D%0AEverything else (%60main%60, branches syncing, PyPI publishing) is **automated**. %E2%9C%A8%0D%0A%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0AYour workflow:%0D%0A1. Code in develop (push anytime)%0D%0A2. When ready to release:%0D%0A   - Merge develop to release%0D%0A   - Push tags to release%0D%0A   - Go have coffee %E2%98%95%0D%0A3. Automation handles:%0D%0A   - Validation %E2%9C%93%0D%0A   - PyPI publishing %E2%9C%93%0D%0A   - Main branch update %E2%9C%93%0D%0A   - Develop syncing %E2%9C%93%0D%0A4. You're done! %F0%9F%8E%89%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %F0%9F%93%9A See Also%0D%0A- %5BBranch Protection Configuration%5D(./BRANCH_PROTECTION_GUIDE.md)%0D%0A- %5BRelease Process Documentation%5D(../docs/RELEASE_PROCESS.md)
